channel.title: mysqlclient on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in mysqlclient on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Accelerate large numbers of simple queries with MySQL
item.description: No matter how light a query is, for example, if the RTT between the web server and MySQL is 5ms and you execute 20 queries, the RTT alone will take 100ms. The technique of using bulk insert (a query that writes multiple lines after VALUES) is well known when inserting a lot of data. However, this technique cannot be used in the following cases. I want to insert 1 row at a time into multiple tables I want to combine multiple UPDATEs and SELECTs For example, there was the following scene in one of our projects.
